texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: keto
texts.text: keto

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I finished Dr. Jason Fung's  The Obesity Code  earlier this week and it really made me think about how the nature of food and eating have changed over time. At a high level, the book focuses on not only  what  we eat, but  when  we eat.
texts.text: I finished Dr. Jason Fung's  The Obesity Code  earlier this week and it really made me think about how the nature of food and eating have changed over time. At a high level, the book focuses on not only  what  we eat, but  when  we eat.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This post includes some of the biggest takeaways that stayed with me after I finished reading it. However, the book has tons of excellent analogies to help you understand complicated systems in the body and their related medical conditions. It also includes results from many studies done over the past 200 years as well as deep dives into where some of our modern nutritional guidance started.
texts.text: This post includes some of the biggest takeaways that stayed with me after I finished reading it. However, the book has tons of excellent analogies to help you understand complicated systems in the body and their related medical conditions. It also includes results from many studies done over the past 200 years as well as deep dives into where some of our modern nutritional guidance started.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I highly recommend reading the entire book. Dr. Fung's writing style makes it easy to understand complicated tasks, and if you don't understand something, he reiterates his points in subsequent chapters to drive important messages home. (Love books? Get a copy of Dr. Fung's other excellent book,  The Cancer Code .)
texts.text: I highly recommend reading the entire book. Dr. Fung's writing style makes it easy to understand complicated tasks, and if you don't understand something, he reiterates his points in subsequent chapters to drive important messages home. (Love books? Get a copy of Dr. Fung's other excellent book,  The Cancer Code .)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: But before we get into this topic, we need a disclaimer.
texts.text: But before we get into this topic, we need a disclaimer.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Disclaimer
texts.text: Disclaimer

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I'm not a medical doctor and I couldn't play one on TV even if I tried. I'm just a person trying to improve my own health without landing in a fad diet that doesn't work. I also have nothing to sell to you.
texts.text: I'm not a medical doctor and I couldn't play one on TV even if I tried. I'm just a person trying to improve my own health without landing in a fad diet that doesn't work. I also have nothing to sell to you.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Before you embark on any big changes with eating or exercise, talk with a medical professional to ensure you don't have any underlying conditions that would worsen with the changes. But, if your doctor tries to get you onto a low-fat, high-carb diet, I'd strongly recommend getting a second opinion. 😉
texts.text: Before you embark on any big changes with eating or exercise, talk with a medical professional to ensure you don't have any underlying conditions that would worsen with the changes. But, if your doctor tries to get you onto a low-fat, high-carb diet, I'd strongly recommend getting a second opinion. 😉

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Why this topic?
texts.text: Why this topic?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I  started on the keto diet  back at the end of 2019 in the hope of improving my own health. My sleep patterns were terrible, I was on blood pressure medication, and my seasonal allergies really slowed me down. My weight wasn't ideal, either.
texts.text: I  started on the keto diet  back at the end of 2019 in the hope of improving my own health. My sleep patterns were terrible, I was on blood pressure medication, and my seasonal allergies really slowed me down. My weight wasn't ideal, either.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It's August 2022 and I'm still going with keto. My weight is down from 200-210 lbs (90.7-95.25kg) to 170-175 lbs (77.1-79.4kg) and that puts me in a healthy zone at 6'1" (1.85m) tall. My blood pressure medicine went away a long time ago, as did most of my allergy medications (prescription and over the counter). I'm an active runner and I either run or walk about 3.2 miles (5km) daily.
texts.text: It's August 2022 and I'm still going with keto. My weight is down from 200-210 lbs (90.7-95.25kg) to 170-175 lbs (77.1-79.4kg) and that puts me in a healthy zone at 6'1" (1.85m) tall. My blood pressure medicine went away a long time ago, as did most of my allergy medications (prescription and over the counter). I'm an active runner and I either run or walk about 3.2 miles (5km) daily.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I feel  great .
texts.text: I feel  great .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, I see constant updates on statistics around obesity in the news and in medical studies. I'm eager to find any details out there that reinforce my knowledge on the diet, question my assumptions, or offer me ways to improve it. This book is just one of many I've read to better understand how my own body works.
texts.text: However, I see constant updates on statistics around obesity in the news and in medical studies. I'm eager to find any details out there that reinforce my knowledge on the diet, question my assumptions, or offer me ways to improve it. This book is just one of many I've read to better understand how my own body works.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: My takeaways
texts.text: My takeaways

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Just as a reminder, these are only the big things that stuck with me after finishing the book. You should read it to get the full picture since you may be more interested in different topics.
texts.text: Just as a reminder, these are only the big things that stuck with me after finishing the book. You should read it to get the full picture since you may be more interested in different topics.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Caloric restrictions don't work
texts.text: Caloric restrictions don't work

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Many diets focus on reducing calories and they've been proven to fail over and over again. Dr. Fung provides several studies in the book that show a few different things:
texts.text: Many diets focus on reducing calories and they've been proven to fail over and over again. Dr. Fung provides several studies in the book that show a few different things:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Initially, you lose weight, but it comes back
texts.text: Initially, you lose weight, but it comes back

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Your body reduces the caloric output when you reduce the input
texts.text: Your body reduces the caloric output when you reduce the input

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Keeping a low calorie diet going for long periods of time is extremely difficult
texts.text: Keeping a low calorie diet going for long periods of time is extremely difficult

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Lowering calories doesn't lower insulin levels over the long term
texts.text: Lowering calories doesn't lower insulin levels over the long term

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: He provides a great analogy to help understand how the body handles weight. Everyone has a weight point set in their body, much like a thermostat for an air conditioner. If it's too cold in your room, you could start up a space heater or start the fireplace. The thermostat will notice the temperature increase and turn on the air conditioner. At some point, your space heater burns out while fighting the air conditioner or you run out of firewood.
texts.text: He provides a great analogy to help understand how the body handles weight. Everyone has a weight point set in their body, much like a thermostat for an air conditioner. If it's too cold in your room, you could start up a space heater or start the fireplace. The thermostat will notice the temperature increase and turn on the air conditioner. At some point, your space heater burns out while fighting the air conditioner or you run out of firewood.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This is how your body works.
texts.text: This is how your body works.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Your body has a set point for weight, like a thermostat, and you must find a way to lower that setting. Dr. Fung notes that insulin levels are a huge factor. If insulin levels remain high for extended periods, the body thinks it needs to take on more fat and store the energy that is coming in. The weight thermostat moves up.
texts.text: Your body has a set point for weight, like a thermostat, and you must find a way to lower that setting. Dr. Fung notes that insulin levels are a huge factor. If insulin levels remain high for extended periods, the body thinks it needs to take on more fat and store the energy that is coming in. The weight thermostat moves up.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Turning that thermostat down requires lowering insulin levels over the long term. These levels spike every time we eat, no matter what we eat.
texts.text: Turning that thermostat down requires lowering insulin levels over the long term. These levels spike every time we eat, no matter what we eat.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: How do we lower the thermostat? Keep reading.
texts.text: How do we lower the thermostat? Keep reading.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Avoid refined carbohydrates
texts.text: Avoid refined carbohydrates

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You probably knew this was coming. Dr. Fung notes that nothing raises insulin levels higher in the body than sugars. However, there are differences based on what you're consuming, whether it's plain table sugar, high fructose corn syrup, or artificial sugars.
texts.text: You probably knew this was coming. Dr. Fung notes that nothing raises insulin levels higher in the body than sugars. However, there are differences based on what you're consuming, whether it's plain table sugar, high fructose corn syrup, or artificial sugars.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: So much of the wheat we consume today isn't the same as it used to be. Lots of packaged foods contain hidden sugars or so much processing that barely any of the original nutrients remain. Any keto dieter can tell you that removing these foods will kick the keto diet into high gear.
texts.text: So much of the wheat we consume today isn't the same as it used to be. Lots of packaged foods contain hidden sugars or so much processing that barely any of the original nutrients remain. Any keto dieter can tell you that removing these foods will kick the keto diet into high gear.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As stated earlier, caloric reduction doesn't work. So if you're removing calories from refined carbohydrates, something must fill the gap left behind.
texts.text: As stated earlier, caloric reduction doesn't work. So if you're removing calories from refined carbohydrates, something must fill the gap left behind.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That's where an increase in fat and protein helps. Fat and protein do raise insulin levels, like any food, but the levels increase by a much smaller amount. In addition, he cites several studies that show saturated fat levels in the blood remaining relatively steady when people consume high-fat meals.
texts.text: That's where an increase in fat and protein helps. Fat and protein do raise insulin levels, like any food, but the levels increase by a much smaller amount. In addition, he cites several studies that show saturated fat levels in the blood remaining relatively steady when people consume high-fat meals.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I can vouch for this myself. My diet consists of fat as the number one source of calories and my triglycerides look fantastic. My A1C is down from where it was before starting keto and my cholesterol numbers are in a normal range.
texts.text: I can vouch for this myself. My diet consists of fat as the number one source of calories and my triglycerides look fantastic. My A1C is down from where it was before starting keto and my cholesterol numbers are in a normal range.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That leads to another good point from the book: 75% of the cholesterol in your blood comes from what your body makes. Only about 25% comes from your diet. But not all cholesterol is the same. You can break the HDL/LDL into many different types and there are types in both categories that are helpful and harmful.
texts.text: That leads to another good point from the book: 75% of the cholesterol in your blood comes from what your body makes. Only about 25% comes from your diet. But not all cholesterol is the same. You can break the HDL/LDL into many different types and there are types in both categories that are helpful and harmful.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Think more about when and less about what
texts.text: Think more about when and less about what

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Dr. Fung argues that you should focus on  when  you eat a lot more than about  what  you eat. (But avoid the refined carbohydrates anyway.)
texts.text: Dr. Fung argues that you should focus on  when  you eat a lot more than about  what  you eat. (But avoid the refined carbohydrates anyway.)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: But there's one thing I am sure of:  intermittent fasting is my nemesis.
texts.text: But there's one thing I am sure of:  intermittent fasting is my nemesis.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Dr. Fung provides lots of study results that show fasting as a critical part of reducing obesity and keeping insulin levels in check. He even cites a study where someone went on a therapeutic (and medically supervised) fast for 382 days and was totally healthy afterwards. Reading things like that makes it seem less insurmountable.
texts.text: Dr. Fung provides lots of study results that show fasting as a critical part of reducing obesity and keeping insulin levels in check. He even cites a study where someone went on a therapeutic (and medically supervised) fast for 382 days and was totally healthy afterwards. Reading things like that makes it seem less insurmountable.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The body knows how to handle a fast and takes many actions to ensure we are performing our best during a fast. Think about early humans. Sometimes they would have a large meal after a hunt but then winter comes and food becomes scarce. When the body goes without food, it begins to think: "Hey, we better be smart and be on the lookout for something to eat."
texts.text: The body knows how to handle a fast and takes many actions to ensure we are performing our best during a fast. Think about early humans. Sometimes they would have a large meal after a hunt but then winter comes and food becomes scarce. When the body goes without food, it begins to think: "Hey, we better be smart and be on the lookout for something to eat."

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Keto dieters who intermittently fast will tell you that during their fast, their focus improves. The body makes adjustments to blood glucose levels and overall blood flow to ensure we're operating at our best. If we're not, then we might miss our next meal.
texts.text: Keto dieters who intermittently fast will tell you that during their fast, their focus improves. The body makes adjustments to blood glucose levels and overall blood flow to ensure we're operating at our best. If we're not, then we might miss our next meal.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Dr. Fung provides 24-hour or 36-hour fasts as examples. These may be tough for beginners. I've found that any adjustments I can make, even if it's just skipping a meal, seems to improve how I feel.
texts.text: Dr. Fung provides 24-hour or 36-hour fasts as examples. These may be tough for beginners. I've found that any adjustments I can make, even if it's just skipping a meal, seems to improve how I feel.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My current pattern is called the 16/8 because you spend 16 hours fasting with an 8 hour eating window. My window runs from 11AM to 7PM so I can eat lunch and dinner without being tempted to eat late in the evening (which is rough on sleep patterns). If you want to try something simple, try skipping breakfast (which is named as such because it's a  break  in the  fast  you have while sleeping). 😉
texts.text: My current pattern is called the 16/8 because you spend 16 hours fasting with an 8 hour eating window. My window runs from 11AM to 7PM so I can eat lunch and dinner without being tempted to eat late in the evening (which is rough on sleep patterns). If you want to try something simple, try skipping breakfast (which is named as such because it's a  break  in the  fast  you have while sleeping). 😉

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Going forward
texts.text: Going forward

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My ability to resist refined carbohydrates and high sugar meals is superb right now, but it's taken a long time to get here. I thought this would be the most difficult thing to overcome, but surprisingly, a cake, a dish of crème brûlée, or an ice cream seem unappetizing to me now. (Boy, I never thought I could escape the clutches of a good crème brûlée.)
texts.text: My ability to resist refined carbohydrates and high sugar meals is superb right now, but it's taken a long time to get here. I thought this would be the most difficult thing to overcome, but surprisingly, a cake, a dish of crème brûlée, or an ice cream seem unappetizing to me now. (Boy, I never thought I could escape the clutches of a good crème brûlée.)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, there are two things I don't do well right now:
texts.text: However, there are two things I don't do well right now:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I turn to artificial sugars far too often but they raise insulin levels, too (sometimes as much as regular sugar)
texts.text: I turn to artificial sugars far too often but they raise insulin levels, too (sometimes as much as regular sugar)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I still don't drink enough water
texts.text: I still don't drink enough water

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My plan is to drink more water regularly, especially while fasting, and find a way to reduce my artificial sugar intake a bit more.
texts.text: My plan is to drink more water regularly, especially while fasting, and find a way to reduce my artificial sugar intake a bit more.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Luckily, a friend told me about  r/Hydrohomies  on Reddit so I can get my water reminder along with hilarious memes. 🤣 💦
texts.text: Luckily, a friend told me about  r/Hydrohomies  on Reddit so I can get my water reminder along with hilarious memes. 🤣 💦

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As always, if you want any of my perspectives on keto and intermittent fasting so far, ask me anytime.
texts.text: As always, if you want any of my perspectives on keto and intermittent fasting so far, ask me anytime.
